result.execSummary:
The defendant Siegfried Almestica was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In lieu of costs defendant to serve 3 days Jail.  Sentence credit for 3 days were granted.  TIME SERVED.
Straight time.  Sentence credit for 50 days were granted.  TIME SERVED

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Siegfried Almestica

defendant.name: Almestica, Siegfried
defendant.address: C/o Waukesha County Jail  515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Siegfried Almestica in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1, court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements.  Defendant's girlfriend makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following to count #1:
50 days jail, 50 days credit.  TIME SERVED.
Costs: $243.00 in lieu of costs defendant to serve 3 days jail.  Credit of 3 days.  TIME SERVED.

Defendant Siegfried Almestica in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek advises he is still waiting on an offer from the DA.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Siegfried Almestica in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cameron Weitzner appeared as prior counsel for the defendant.  Attorney Weitzner advises Attorney Kershek is now handling this case.  Attorney Kershek makes statements.  Court approves withdrawl of Attorney Weitzner.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Siegfried Almestica in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
